power_sequencer.channel_offset.description: Move selected strip to the nearest open channel above/down
power_sequencer.channel_offset.name: Channel Offset
shortcuts: Move to Channel Above and Trim
Move to Channel Below and Trim

power_sequencer.concatenate_strips.description:
*brief* Remove space between strips

Concatenates selected strips in a channel, i.e. removes the gap between them. If a single
strip is selected, either the next strip in the channel will be concatenated, or all
strips in the channel will be concatenated depending on which shortcut is used.
power_sequencer.concatenate_strips.name: Concatenate Strips
shortcuts: Concatenate and select the next strip in the channel
Concatenate all strips in selected channels
Concatenate and select the previous strip in the channel towards the right
Shift Alt C; Concatenate all strips in channel towards the right

power_sequencer.copy_markers_as_timecode.description: Formats and copies all the markers as timecodes to put in a Youtube video's description
power_sequencer.copy_markers_as_timecode.name: Copy Markers As Timecodes

power_sequencer.copy_selected_sequences.description:
*brief* Copy/cut strips without offset from current time indicator


Copies the selected sequences without frame offset and optionally
deletes the selection to give a cut to clipboard effect. This
operator overrides the default Blender copy method which includes
cursor offset when pasting, which is atypical of copy/paste methods.
power_sequencer.copy_selected_sequences.name: Copy Selected Sequences

power_sequencer.crossfade_add.description:
*brief* Adds cross fade between selected sequence and the closest sequence to its right

Based on the active strip, finds the closest next sequence of a similar type, moves it
so it overlaps the active strip, and adds a gamma cross effect between them. Works with
MOVIE, IMAGE and META strips
power_sequencer.crossfade_add.name: Crossfade Add

power_sequencer.crossfade_edit.description:
*brief* Adjust the location of the crossfade between 2 strips


Selects the handles of both inputs of a crossfade strip's input and
calls the grab operator. Allows you to quickly change the location
of a fade transition between two strips.
power_sequencer.crossfade_edit.name: Crossfade Edit

power_sequencer.delete_direct.description: Deletes strips without confirmation, and cleans up crossfades nicely
power_sequencer.delete_direct.name: Delete Direct

power_sequencer.deselect_all_strips_left.description:
Deselects all the strips at the left or right of the time cursor, based on the position
of the mouse
power_sequencer.deselect_all_strips_left.name: Deselect All Strips Left Or Right
shortcuts: Deselect all strips to the left of the time cursor
Deselect all strips to the right of the time cursor

power_sequencer.deselect_handles_and_gra.description: Deselect the handles of all selected strips and call the Sequence Slide operator
power_sequencer.deselect_handles_and_gra.name: Deselect Handles And Grab

power_sequencer.duplicate_move.description:
Auto selects the strip under the mouse if nothing is selected, and calls Blender's
Duplicate Move function
power_sequencer.duplicate_move.name: Duplicate Move

power_sequencer.expand_to_surrounding_cu.description:
*Brief* Expand selected strips to surrounding cuts

Finds potential gaps surrounding each block of selected sequences and extends the corresponding
sequence handle to it
power_sequencer.expand_to_surrounding_cu.name: Expand To Surrounding Cuts

power_sequencer.fade_add.description:
*brief* Adds or updates a fade animation for either visual or audio strips

Fade options:

- In, Out, In and Out create a fade animation of the given duration from
the start of the sequence, to the end of the sequence, or on both sides
- From playhead: the fade animation goes from the start of sequences under the playhead to the playhead
- To playhead: the fade animation goes from the playhead to the end of sequences under the playhead

By default, the duration of the fade is 1 second
power_sequencer.fade_add.name: Fade Add

power_sequencer.fade_clear.description:
*brief* Removes fade animation from selected sequences

Removes opacity or volume animation on selected sequences and resets the
property to a value of 1.0. Works on all types of sequences
power_sequencer.fade_clear.name: Fade Clear

power_sequencer.gap_remove.description: Remove gaps, starting from the first frame, with the ability to ignore locked strips
power_sequencer.gap_remove.name: Gap Remove

power_sequencer.grab.description:
*brief* Grab and move sequences. Extends Blender's built-in grab tool


Grab and move sequences. If you have no strips selected, it automatically
finds the strip closest to the mouse and selects it. If you only select
one or multiple crossfades, selects the handles on either side of the
crossfades before moving sequences, using POWER_SEQUENCER_OT_crossfade_edit
power_sequencer.grab.name: Grab

power_sequencer.grab_closest_cut.description:
*brief* Grab the handles that form the closest cut


Selects and grabs the strip handle or cut closest to the mouse cursor.
Hover near a cut and fire this tool to slide it.
power_sequencer.grab_closest_cut.name: Grab Closest Cut

power_sequencer.grab_sequence_handles.description:
*brief* Grabs the sequence's handle based on the mouse position


Extends the sequence based on the mouse position. If the cursor is to the
right of the sequence's middle, it moves the right handle. If it's on the
left side, it moves the left handle.
power_sequencer.grab_sequence_handles.name: Grab Sequence Handles

power_sequencer.import_local_footage.description:
*brief* Imports video, images, and audio from the project folder

Finds and imports all valid video, audio files, and pictures in the blend file's folder and
sub-folders, ignoring folders named BL_proxy.

If you set it in the add-on preferences, it also sets imported sequences to use proxies. See
`Preferences -> Add-ons -> Blender Power Sequencer -> Proxy`
power_sequencer.import_local_footage.name: Import Local Footage

power_sequencer.jump_time_offset.description:
*brief* Jump forward or backward in time


Move the time cursor forward or backward, using a duration in seconds.

The equivalent tool in Blender only works with frames, meaning the jump
will be different if your project's framerate is different. This tool
fixes that issue.
power_sequencer.jump_time_offset.name: Jump Time Offset

power_sequencer.jump_to_cut.description:
*brief* Jump to next/previous cut


Jump to the next or the previous cut in the edit.  Unlike Blender's default tool, also
works during playback.
power_sequencer.jump_to_cut.name: Jump To Cut
shortcuts: Jump to next cut or keyframe
Jump to previous cut or keyframe

power_sequencer.make_hold_frame.description:
*brief* Make a hold frame from the active strip

Converts the image under the cursor to a hold frame, to create a pause effect in the video,
using the active sequence
power_sequencer.make_hold_frame.name: Make Hold Frame

power_sequencer.marker_delete_closest.description: Deletes the marker closest to the time cursor
power_sequencer.marker_delete_closest.name: Marker Delete Closest

power_sequencer.marker_delete_direct.description: Delete selected markers instantly skipping the default confirmation prompt
power_sequencer.marker_delete_direct.name: Marker Delete Direct

power_sequencer.marker_snap_to_cursor.description: Snap selected marker to the time cursor
power_sequencer.marker_snap_to_cursor.name: Marker Snap To Cursor

power_sequencer.markers_create_from_sele.description:
*brief* Create one marker at the start on each selected strip, based on its name

Use it to copy markers as timecodes.
power_sequencer.markers_create_from_sele.name: Markers Create From Selected Strips

power_sequencer.markers_snap_matching_st.description: Snap selected strips to markers with the same name
power_sequencer.markers_snap_matching_st.name: Markers Snap Matching Strips

power_sequencer.merge_from_scene_strip.description:
*brief* Copies all sequences and markers from a SceneStrip's scene into
the active scene. Optionally delete the source scene and the strip

WARNING: Currently the operator doesn't recreate any animation data,
be careful by choosing to delete the scene after the merge
power_sequencer.merge_from_scene_strip.name: Merge From Scene Strip

power_sequencer.meta_resize_to_content.description:
*brief* Moves the handles of the selected metastrip so it fits its content


Use it to trim a metastrip quickly
power_sequencer.meta_resize_to_content.name: Meta Resize To Content

power_sequencer.meta_trim_content_to_bou.description: Deletes and trims the strips inside selected meta-strips to the meta strip's bounds
power_sequencer.meta_trim_content_to_bou.name: Meta Trim Content To Bounds

power_sequencer.meta_ungroup_and_trim.description: UnMeta all selected meta strips and trim their content
power_sequencer.meta_ungroup_and_trim.name: Meta Ungroup And Trim

power_sequencer.mouse_toggle_mute.description: Toggle mute a sequence as you click on it
power_sequencer.mouse_toggle_mute.name: Mouse Toggle Mute

power_sequencer.mouse_trim.description:
*brief* Cut or Trim strips quickly with the mouse cursor


Click somewhere in the Sequencer to insert a cut, click and drag to trim
With this function you can quickly cut and remove a section of strips while keeping or
collapsing the remaining gap.
Press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> to snap to cuts.

A [video demo](https://youtu.be/GiLmDhmMVAM?t=1m35s) is available.
power_sequencer.mouse_trim.name: Mouse Trim
shortcuts: Trim in all channels and remove gaps
Trim using the mouse cursor and remove gaps
Trim in all channels and remove gaps

power_sequencer.mouse_trim_instantly.description:
*brief* Trim strip from a start to an end frame instantly


Trims a frame range or a selection from a start to an end frame.
If there's no precise time range, auto trims based on the closest cut

Args:
- frame_start and frame_end (int) define the frame range to trim
power_sequencer.mouse_trim_instantly.name: Mouse Trim Instantly

power_sequencer.open_project_directory.description: Opens the Blender project directory in file explorer
power_sequencer.open_project_directory.name: Open Project Directory

power_sequencer.open_scene_strip.description: Sets the current scene to the scene in the SceneStrip
power_sequencer.open_scene_strip.name: Open Scene Strip

power_sequencer.playback_speed_decrease.description:
*brief* Decrease playback speed incrementally down to normal


Playback speed may be set to any of the following speeds:

* Normal (1x)
* Fast (1.33x)
* Faster (1.66x)
* Double (2x)
* Triple (3x)

Activating this operator will decrease playback speed through each
of these steps until minimum speed is reached.
power_sequencer.playback_speed_decrease.name: Playback Speed Decrease

power_sequencer.playback_speed_increase.description:
*brief* Increase playback speed up to triple


Playback speed may be set to any of the following speeds:

* Normal (1x)
* Fast (1.33x)
* Faster (1.66x)
* Double (2x)
* Triple (3x)

Activating this operator will increase playback speed through each
of these steps until maximum speed is reached.
power_sequencer.playback_speed_increase.name: Playback Speed Increase

power_sequencer.playback_speed_set.description: Change the playback_speed property using an operator property. Used with keymaps
power_sequencer.playback_speed_set.name: Playback Speed Set

power_sequencer.preview_closest_cut.description:
*brief* Toggle preview around the closest cut, based on time cursor


Finds the closest cut to the time cursor and sets the preview to a small range around that
frame. If the preview matches the range, resets to the full timeline
power_sequencer.preview_closest_cut.name: Preview Closest Cut

power_sequencer.preview_to_selection.description:
*brief* Sets the timeline preview range to match the selection

Sets the scene frame start to the earliest frame start of selected sequences and the scene
frame end to the last frame of selected sequences.
Uses all sequences in the current context if no sequences are selected.
power_sequencer.preview_to_selection.name: Preview To Selection

power_sequencer.render_apply_preset.description:
*Brief* Applies a rendering preset to the project

Sets rendering and encoding settings and an output filename based on a preset.

Available presets:

- YouTube: 1080p mp4 video encoded with H264 and AAC for audio, based on YouTube's recommended settings
- Twitter: 720p mp4 video
power_sequencer.render_apply_preset.name: Render Apply Preset

power_sequencer.ripple_delete.description: Delete selected strips and remove remaining gaps
power_sequencer.ripple_delete.name: Ripple Delete

power_sequencer.save_direct.description: Saves current file without prompting for confirmation. Overrides Blender default
power_sequencer.save_direct.name: Save Direct

power_sequencer.scene_create_from_select.description:
*brief* Convert selected strips into a scene strip


Create a scene from the selected sequences, copying the current scene's settings, and
replace the selection with the newly created scene as a strip
power_sequencer.scene_create_from_select.name: Scene Create From Selection

power_sequencer.scene_rename_with_strip.description: Rename a Scene Strip and its source scene
power_sequencer.scene_rename_with_strip.name: Scene Rename With Strip

power_sequencer.select_all_left_or_right.description: *Brief* Selects all strips left or right of the time cursor
power_sequencer.select_all_left_or_right.name: Select All Left Or Right
shortcuts: Select all strips to the LEFT of the time cursor
Select all strips to the right of the time cursor

power_sequencer.select_closest_to_mouse.description: Select the closest strip under the mouse cursor
power_sequencer.select_closest_to_mouse.name: Select Closest To Mouse

power_sequencer.select_linked_effect.description: Select all strips that are linked by an effect strip
power_sequencer.select_linked_effect.name: Select Linked Effect

power_sequencer.select_linked_strips.description:
Add/Remove linked strips near mouse pointer to/from selection without the need to
previously have clicked/manually selected
power_sequencer.select_linked_strips.name: Select Linked Strips

power_sequencer.select_related_strips.description:
*brief* Find and select all strips related to the selection


Find and select effects related to the selection, but also inputs of selected effects.
This helps to then copy or duplicate strips with all attached effects.
power_sequencer.select_related_strips.name: Select Related Strips

power_sequencer.select_strips_under_curs.description: Selects the strips that are currently under the time cursor
power_sequencer.select_strips_under_curs.name: Select Strips Under Cursor

power_sequencer.set_preview_between_mark.description: Set the timeline's preview range using the 2 markers closest to the time cursor
power_sequencer.set_preview_between_mark.name: Set Preview Between Markers

power_sequencer.set_timeline_range.description: Set the timeline start and end frame using the time cursor
power_sequencer.set_timeline_range.name: Set Timeline Range

power_sequencer.snap.description:
*Brief* Snaps selected strips to the time cursor ignoring locked sequences.

Automatically selects sequences if there is no active selection
power_sequencer.snap.name: Snap

power_sequencer.snap_selection.description:
*Brief* Snap the entire selection to the time cursor.

Automatically selects sequences if there is no active selection.
To snap each strip individually, see Snap
power_sequencer.snap_selection.name: Snap Selection

power_sequencer.space_sequences.description: *brief* Offsets all strips to the right of the time cursor by a given duration, ignoring locked sequences
power_sequencer.space_sequences.name: Space Sequences

power_sequencer.speed_remove_effect.description:
*brief* Removes speed from META, un-groups META


This is the opposite of power_sequencer's "Add Speed" operator.  It seeks out and removes
the speed modifier inside a meta and ungroups all the remaining strips within.
power_sequencer.speed_remove_effect.name: Speed Remove Effect

power_sequencer.speed_up_movie_strip.description:
*brief* Adds a speed effect to the  2x speed, set frame end, wrap both into META

Add 2x speed to strip and set its frame end accordingly. Wraps both the strip and the speed
modifier into a META strip.
power_sequencer.speed_up_movie_strip.name: Speed Up Movie Strip

power_sequencer.split_strips_under_curso.description:
Splits all strips under cursor including muted strips, but excluding locked strips.
Auto selects sequences under the time cursor when you don't have a selection
power_sequencer.split_strips_under_curso.name: Split Strips Under Cursor

power_sequencer.swap_strips.description:
*brief* Swaps the 2 strips between them


Places the first strip in the channel and starting frame (frame_final_start) of the second
strip, and places the second strip in the channel and starting frame (frame_final_end) of
the first strip.  If there is no space for the swap, it does nothing.
power_sequencer.swap_strips.name: Swap Strips

power_sequencer.toggle_waveforms.description:
*brief* Toggle audio waveforms

Toggle drawing of waveforms for selected strips or for all audio strips if no selection
is active.
power_sequencer.toggle_waveforms.name: Toggle Waveforms

power_sequencer.transitions_remove.description: Delete a crossfade strip and moves the handles of the input strips to form a cut again
power_sequencer.transitions_remove.name: Transitions Remove

power_sequencer.trim_left_or_right_handl.description:
Trims or extends the handle closest to the time cursor for all selected strips.

If you keep the Shift key down, the edit will ripple through the timeline.
Auto selects sequences under the time cursor when you don't have a selection
power_sequencer.trim_left_or_right_handl.name: Trim Left Or Right Handles

power_sequencer.trim_three_point_edit.description: Trim the closest strip under the mouse cursor in or out
power_sequencer.trim_three_point_edit.name: Trim Three Point Edit

power_sequencer.trim_to_surrounding_cuts.description:
*Brief* Automatically trim to surrounding cuts with some time offset

Finds the two cuts closest to the mouse cursor and trims the footage in between, leaving a
little time offset. It's useful after you removed some bad audio but you need to keep some
video around for a transition.

By default, the tool leaves a 0.2 seconds margin on either side of the trim.
power_sequencer.trim_to_surrounding_cuts.name: Trim To Surrounding Cuts

power_sequencer.value_offset.description: Instantly offset selected strips, either using frames or seconds. Allows to nudge the selection quickly, using keyboard shortcuts
power_sequencer.value_offset.name: Value Offset
shortcuts: Offset the selection to the left.
Offset the selection to the right.
